Speaker: mia
Dialogue: ...and I swear to God, she was wrecked. It was pure insanity.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Don't worry, it is. I know sometimes it --

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Where do you think you're going?

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: You'd better be here early tomorrow.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I wanted to give you an entrance.

Speaker: alexis
Dialogue: Same here. Was Jen there? Or Rachel?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I don't know who Jen and Rachel are.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I don't know if they were there.

Speaker: caitlin
Dialogue: Why is there a convention in the bathroom?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Two minutes, people! Mia you're coming, right?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Look, I know things didn't go well today. There are four things in my inbox that you're perfect for and I will submit you. But right now -- you're coming.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: It'll be a bunch of social climbers packed into one of those glass houses.

Speaker: alexis
Dialogue: Come on, Mia. When else do you get to see every Hollywood clich crammed into a single home?

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: Lex! I'm disappointed in you. There's nothing to make fun of. This party will be humanity at its finest.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You gotta stop breaking into my home.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: You think Mom or Dad would call this a home?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Yes. Hoagy Carmichael sat on that stool. The Baked Potato was gonna throw it away.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I wonder why.  I brought you this. It's a throw rug.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Yeah? What if I told you Miles Davis pissed on it?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: When are you going to unpack these boxes?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: When I unpack them in my club.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Oh my God. It's like a girl broke up with you and you're stalking her.  You're not still going by there, are you?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Who wants to tapas while they samba?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I have someone I want you to meet.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I don't want to meet anyone.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Then what are we gonna talk about?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Ok. Then I have someone I'd like you to meet. He's got a face tattoo, but a heart of gold.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: You need to get serious. You live like a hermit. You're driving without insurance.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I am serious. I had a very serious plan for my future. It's not my fault I got Shanghai'ed.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: You did not get "Shanghai'ed", you got ripped off.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: It's not as romantic as that.  And everyone knew that guy was shady except for you.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Why do you say romantic like it's a dirty word?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Unpaid bills are not romantic. Call her.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You're acting like life's got me on the ropes -- what you don't understand is, I want to be on the ropes. I'm letting life hit me `til it gets tired. Then I'm gonna make my move. It's a classic rope-a-dope.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I love you. Unpack your boxes.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I'm a phoenix rising from the ashes!

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Bill. Thanks for having me back.

Speaker: boss
Dialogue: Your welcome. Stick to the set list.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Of course.  Though I don't think they care what I play.

Speaker: boss
Dialogue: I do, and I don't want to hear the free jazz.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: How `bout one for you, one for me? Or two for you, one for me?  Or all for you, none for me? Ok, that works. Good deal.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: There's a nice way to say that.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I'll stick to the set list, I promise --

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You're not gonna find a better player. You know that.

Speaker: boss
Dialogue: Do you think anyone here gives a shit?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I just wanted to say -- I saw your playing, and I --

Speaker: tracy
Dialogue: There you are! You need to meet someone! Carlo, this is Mia. Mia, Carlo's a writer.

Speaker: carlo
Dialogue: They say I have a knack for world-building.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Congratulations. I have to grab a drink...

Speaker: singer
Dialogue: Alright, one more for y'all before we break. Do I hear any requests?

Speaker: singer
Dialogue: "I Ran" it is.  Wanna start us off, piano-man?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Ok I was an asshole. I can admit that.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: But requesting "I Ran" from a serious musician -- it's too far.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: My God. Did you just call yourself "a serious musician"?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Can I borrow what you're wearing?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Because I have an audition next week. I'm playing a serious fire-fighter.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: So you're an actress. That makes sense. Have I seen you in anything?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Uh... The coffee shop on the Warner Brothers lot. That's a classic.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Oh, you're a barista. Well now I see how you can look down on me from all the way up there.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: He doesn't tell me what to do.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: He just told you what to do.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Mia. Guess I'll see you in the movies.

Speaker: singer
Dialogue: Never seen you lookin' so lovely as you did tonight...

Speaker: carlo
Dialogue: ...Goldilocks from the point of view of the bears. Home-invasion thriller. Fox and Warners are going crazy for it.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Did you just get your keys?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You didn't give me much of a choice.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Strange that we keep running into each other.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: It is strange. Maybe it means something.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Yeah I don't think so either.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: It turns your head into an antenna. Probably gives you cancer, but you find your car more quickly.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You don't live as long, but you get things done faster, so it all evens out.

Speaker: manager
Dialogue: Do I look like I care? Reschedule it.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Uh-huh. How'd you get on the lot?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Great. I'll hide in the bathroom.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: That's the window Ingrid Bergman and Humphrey Bogart looked out of in Casablanca.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: What's your Bogart's name...?  Is it Greg?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: We've been seeing each other for a few months.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I know what you mean. I get breakfast five miles out of the way just to sit outside a jazz club.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: It was called Van Beek. The swing bands played there. Count Basie. Chick Webb.  It's a samba-tapas place now.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Samba-tapas. It's... Exactly. The joke's on history.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I know. They shoot movies on my street. "C-stands." "Apple box." "Don't forget to sign out."

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: How'd you get into all this?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Into...? Oh -- I -- my aunt was an actress. She was in this traveling theater company... And there was this little library across the street from my house when I was growing up. This was Boulder City, Nevada -- every house looked exactly the same. I was ten and already I needed to get out. And one day, my aunt flew into town, and she showed me the library's old-movie section. We spent a whole day watching one after the other. Bringing Up Baby. Notorious. Casablanca.  I never knew the world was so big.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I started putting on plays in my garage. I'd write the scripts and print up programs, and she'd give me props to use from wherever she'd just been -- New York, London, Paris. And then she'd jet off again and I wouldn't hear from her for another year.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Who would you invite to watch? Your parents?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: God no -- I didn't invite anyone. That would have been terrifying.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Well it doesn't need more actresses.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: What do you mean, "just an actress"?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You said it yourself, you're a child- prodigy playwright.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: That is not what I said.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You're too modest to say it but it's true. So you could write your own roles. Write something that's as interesting as you are.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Last thing I wrote was a stand-up routine for an open-mic night. It was horrible.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: All I'm saying is -- Louis Armstrong could have played the marching-band charts he was given. What did he do instead? He made history.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Ok, I'll stop auditioning and make history instead.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: What does that mean? "I hate jazz"?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: It means when I listen to it I don't like it.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: But it's such a blanket statement. It's like saying "I hate animals".

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Do you need to be anywhere right now?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I thought it was just Kenny G.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I associate it with facials. It's relaxing.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: It's not relaxing! Sid Bechet got into a gunfight `cause somebody told him he played a wrong note!

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Right, but it's good to talk over. Where I grew up there's this jazz station they'd play at cocktail parties whenever they served the salami and cheese.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Mia. These are things you can't unsay.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: ...It's gonna be the old Van Beek. I'm getting the lease back. It'll be perfect.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Hi, I just missed a call...

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: That show I told you about.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Right. It's -- actually more like Rebel Without a Cause.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: It's the one I lie about.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Come on. You can't do this audition and never see Rebel. The theater near me's playing it. If you want -- I can take you. For research.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Great, actually: I got a call-back on a pilot.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Well -- it's not picked up yet.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: First they make the pilot, then if they like the pilot it goes on TV.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Well, no, I have a call-back.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: ...Well when you put it like that it sounds like a huge accomplishment.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: You know what, I have to go. I love you.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Two options. Follow my rules, or follow my rules. Kapish? You want to bully, you'd best be ready to get bullied --

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I can do it another way --

Speaker: greg
Dialogue: Hey... I'm parked out front. But we should hurry, my brother just landed.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: That's right -- but now we've got a surround-sound set-up, so it's like --

Speaker: fiancee
Dialogue: It's like being in a movie theater.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: It's better than going to a theater, really. You know theaters these days --

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: -- they're so dirty, and they're either too hot or too cold, and there's always people talking, which is just --  Hello?...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Yeah, I'll have to call you back.  So, yeah, we love it.

Speaker: greg
Dialogue: I've never heard anyone say that. Was it amazing?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Oh my God. A five-star jungle eco-resort. It was unbelievable.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: It's a play. I'm going to put it on myself.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Actually -- it's a -- it's a one-woman show...

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: This is Mia. Mia, Keith.  We used to play together.

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: Keeping busy. Got a new combo.

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: Let's just grab a drink then. Call me. It's been too long.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I don't know... Is the whole thing too nostalgic?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: But do you think people will like it?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Fine -- as long as you sit front-row `cause I'll probably throw up on the middle of the stage otherwise.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: It could be the name design. On the door.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: That's what you should name it.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Sebastian, no one's going to a club called "Chicken on a Stick".

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You don't get it. Charlie Parker got the name "Bird" because he loved chicken. So my club's gonna be old-school jazz and beer and chicken. "Chicken on a Stick".

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: No. Drop the chicken. Drinks and jazz.  And it's time to start looking for other places.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: It's gotta be Van Beek. I can't let them samba all over its history.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: The one who offered you a gig.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You mean Keith? He's the worst.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Why was it weird between you two?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: He did offer you a job.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Are you going to call him?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Here's what we know. It's definitely Chicken on a Stick --  -- and your play is going to be a triumph.

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: Here's the deal. We've got distribution with Universal, got our own imprint. We're about to go on the road. We can cut you in for 1K a week while we tour, plus an equal share of any merchandise or ticket revenue that comes in. Sound good?

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: Let's play, see how it feels.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You're holding onto the past. But jazz is about the future.

Speaker: keith
Dialogue: I get it. I got it wrong. Last guy wasn't as good as you. But you're a pain in the ass, man.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Hey. I'm grabbing some pastries, you two want anything?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Same here but I think someone's trying to break into your car.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I think today's San Diego. I'm not sure...

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: You should come over tonight. Harry's cooking, but don't let that stop you.  What's the matter?

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I got used to being alone. Growing up it was just me and Seb. We only had each other.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I wasn't looking for anybody. Then I met Harry and -- we just fit...  You've changed Seb. You know that?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I mean with the band, the travel, all of it.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Our dad never got to do what he wanted. We were always treading water, he took a job running a washer-dryer store. But every night at home he'd play his clarinet along to a Benny Goodman record.  So I look at Sebastian... Playing music, getting paid for it. I'm happy for him.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Oh, right -- I'll eat it I guess.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Hey it's me... Not sure where you are -- maybe Boston? Or Dallas? Anyway... I haven't heard from you in a while... I miss you...  Ok... Bye...

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Because...  What if people show up?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I'm nervous to be up on a stage and perform in front of people. I'm terrified.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: They should be so lucky to see it.  It's going to be incredible. I can't wait.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Yeah, you could knock that off your bucket list.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Well, all my stuff is here and my show's in a few weeks and -- I don't know, it doesn't seem practical...

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Right... I just -- we're going to have to do things so we can see each other. We never see each other.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I know, but when are you done?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: When are you done with the tour?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: But -- as soon as we're done with the tour we go back and record, and then we go back on tour.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I mean the long haul -- like, you're going to be in this band for a long time.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: What did you think I was going to do?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I don't know, I didn't think the band would --

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You didn't think we'd be successful.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: No, that's not what I meant. What I meant was -- this band -- you're going to be on the road for -- what, years now?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Yeah, feasibly -- I could be on the road for years with just this record.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Do you like the music you're playing?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I don't know how that matters.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: It matters if you're going to give up your dream to be on the road for years.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Do you like the music I'm playing?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Yes. I do.  I just didn't think you did.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: And now I hear you're going to be on the road for years, and I'm --

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: What are you doing? Why are you doing this?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: What do you mean why am I doing this?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: This is what you wanted from me.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Yes, I wanted you to have a job so you could take care of yourself and start your club.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: So I'm doing that. So why aren't we celebrating?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Why aren't you starting your club?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You said yourself no one wants to go to that club! No one wants to go to a club called Chicken on a Stick --

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: -- and no one likes jazz. Not even you.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I do like jazz now, because of you.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: What am I supposed to do? Go back to playing "Jingle Bells" so I can save money for some Shangri-La club no one wants to go to?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: People will want to go to it! People love what other people are passionate about.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: You had a dream that you were sticking to, that --

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Guys like me go their whole lives and never do anything that's liked. I'm finally doing something that people enjoy. What is wrong with that?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Why do you care so much about being liked -- ?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You're an actress, who are you to talk??

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I thought that was next Thursday.

Speaker: photographer
Dialogue: Put a light on the drums... I need more fill in this corner...

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I'm -- I'm sorry I missed it -- and I'm sorry I was a dick and I -- I promise I'll make it up to you --

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: No one showed up. I can't even pay back the theater.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Oh God, I didn't see them.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: Yeah. They kept going, "oh Sebastian's so handsome".

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You look beautiful.  I hope it was ok. I haven't played in a while.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: You were great  You're always great when you play.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I'm not gonna be hovering anymore.

Speaker: laura
Dialogue: I think so. Maybe Boston. I don't know, it's exciting...

Speaker: mia's dad
Dialogue: It's fun having you back. Your mom ditches me at ten.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: She was at your play. And she loved it. And she loved it so much that she wants you to come audition for a huge movie she's got.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I'm -- no... That will kill me.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Because I'm probably not good enough.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Why don't you want to do it anymore?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: ...Because it hurts a little bit too much.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I told them you'd be there at five-thirty tomorrow. I'll swing by here before I drive back at eight. Either you'll be outside or you won't.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: The house across from the library.

Speaker: amy brandt
Dialogue: I'm Amy, this is Frank. Glad we found you.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: We want to build the character with you. It's a process. Three-month rehearsal, four-month shoot.

Speaker: amy brandt
Dialogue: So why don't you just tell us a story?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: My aunt lived in Paris for a bit... She used to tell me these stories, when I was growing up, about living abroad...  I remember -- she told me she jumped into the Seine once...

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: They said the next couple of days... But I'm not expecting to find anything out.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: You are. I know these things.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I don't think we can do anything. Because when you get this --

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: When you get this -- you've got to give it everything you've got.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: What are you going to do?

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I've got to follow my own plan. Stay here. Get my own thing going. You know...

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I guess we're just going to have to wait and see.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: You know I'm always going to love you.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I'm always going to love you too.

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I've never been here during the day.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Alright, I'm done.  Harris did a nice job with it.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: No one touches the instruments. Carson's coming an hour early to test levels.

Speaker: employee
Dialogue: I got a check for you to sign.

Speaker: drummer
Dialogue: Like the desert misses the rain.

Speaker: saxophonist
Dialogue: Seb -- Edgar's bringing his horn tonight.

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: Yeah? Tell him to tune it, huh?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: Bye, sweetie. You be nice to Chelsea.

Speaker: david
Dialogue: What if we miss this? What do we tell Natalie?

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: We can just see it back in New York...

Speaker: sebastian
Dialogue: I don't know, I told him to play "Jingle Bells".

Speaker: mia
Dialogue: I just wanted to say -- I saw your playing, and I --

Speaker: david
Dialogue: Do you want to stay for another?
